physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Pallor, dyspnea, and tachycardia with periodic gallop rhythm.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Despite initial therapy with oxygen, digoxin, captopril, and furosemide, cardiovascular function continued to worsen.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chest x-ray showed cardiomegaly; echocardiography revealed left ventricular dilation (diastolic diameter, 41.5 mm), decreased contractility, and mild to moderate mitral valve insufficiency; ECG showed sinus rhythm with left bundle-branch block and repolarization abnormalities.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Deterioration in cardiac function leading to readmission at 10 months of age.
Significant deterioration in cardiovascular status that resulted in death 8 days later.
